## ==üí° THOUGHT==

### ==Education > school==

[==**Jon England**==](https://x.com/Principal_Jon/status/1852735255792472154?utm_source=opened-daily.beehiiv.com&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=078-education-school)==, a homeschool dad and former public school teacher, gave us==¬†==_all of the feelings_==¬†==with this 1-minute montage showing how his family learns in the age of open education:==

[https://platform.twitter.com/embed/Tweet.html?dnt=true&embedId=twitter-widget-0&%3D%3D&frame=false&hideCard=false&hideThread=false&id=1852735255792472154&lang=en&origin=https%3A%2F%2Fopened.co%2Fdaily%2Feducation-school%2F&sessionId=6976d2238c70c4f39f99ebc2f2a7183acb438a05&theme=light&widgetsVersion=2615f7e52b7e0%3A1702314776716&width=500px](https://platform.twitter.com/embed/Tweet.html?dnt=true&embedId=twitter-widget-0&%3D%3D&frame=false&hideCard=false&hideThread=false&id=1852735255792472154&lang=en&origin=https%3A%2F%2Fopened.co%2Fdaily%2Feducation-school%2F&sessionId=6976d2238c70c4f39f99ebc2f2a7183acb438a05&theme=light&widgetsVersion=2615f7e52b7e0%3A1702314776716&width=500px)

==_‚ÄúWhat does it mean to educate our children?_====  
====_Does it mean sitting in a classroom day after day after day? Or is it more than that?_====  
====_Education should follow our curiosities and passions while drawing out our full potential._====  
====_Education enlightens the soul, identifies truths, and gives us a moral compass to live by._====  
====_Education finds the beauty in the world around us. It is full of mistakes, but also opportunities to correct those mistakes._====  
====_And for me, education brings me closer to my family._====  
====_And if your family‚Äôs education isn‚Äôt bringing them joy, if it doesn‚Äôt help them recognize truth and beauty, perhaps it‚Äôs time for a change.‚Äù_==

==JON ENGLAND==

[==Check out¬†Jon‚Äôs work on education policy at the Libertas Institute.==](https://libertas.institute/author/jonengland/?utm_source=opened-daily.beehiiv.com&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=078-education-school)

## ==üìä TREND==

### ==Is Technology Improving Educational Outcomes?==

==A provocative==¬†[==new report from After Babel==](https://www.afterbabel.com/p/the-edtech-revolution-has-failed?r=5d1ba&utm_medium=ios&triedRedirect=true)¬†==suggests that the so-called ‚ÄúEdTech revolution‚Äù has been nothing of the sort. Global test scores are declining, and research shows that students using computers ‚Äúvery frequently‚Äù at school tend to perform==¬†==_worse_====.==

==What‚Äôs interesting is that the same research shows that technology‚Äôs impact varies dramatically depending on how it‚Äôs used:==

- ==Science showed minimal gains (0.18)==
- ==Reading showed small gains (0.25)==
- ==Writing and Math showed modest gains (0.32 and 0.33 respectively)==

==None of these are considered impressive metrics.==

==The one area where the study found a sizable positive impact from technology was for students with specific learning needs==

==**What‚Äôs going on here?**==¬†

==It should be obvious: technology isn‚Äôt a magic wand you can wave over a classroom of 30 diverse learners. It‚Äôs a==¬†==_tool_==¬†==that only works when matched to specific student needs and learning goals. At OpenEd, we don‚Äôt just throw technology at kids ‚Äì we help them integrate it into a==¬†==_personalized learning plan._==

## ==‚öíÔ∏è TOOL==

### ==Exploring Big History==

==‚ÄúMom, why do we have to learn about dead people?‚Äù==

==(üëÜÔ∏è Sound familiar?)==

==Have you heard of the==¬†[==Big History Project==](https://www.oerproject.com/Big-History?utm_source=opened-daily.beehiiv.com&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=078-education-school)==? Instead of starting with ancient civilizations, Big History zooms==¬†==_all the way out_==¬†==to the Big Bang, taking students on a 13.8-billion-year journey from the formation of stars to the rise of complex societies (think Carl Sagan‚Äôs famous ‚ÄúCosmos‚Äù series meets World History).==

==And if you make it all the way through, you can continue with the== [==World History Project==](https://www.oerproject.com/World-History?utm_source=opened-daily.beehiiv.com&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=078-education-school)==, which picks up the human story (yes, the dead people) in more detail.==

==**At a glance:**==

- ==Adapts for grades 6-10==
- ==50+ lessons across 10 units==
- ==62 videos, 117 texts, 40 activities==
- ==Built-in support for all learning levels==

==**Perfect for:**==

- ==Students who need to see the ‚Äúbig picture‚Äù of the day for deep dives into personal interests, projects, and real-world learning.==
- ==Kids who ask ‚Äúbig questions‚Äù==
- ==Science lovers who think history is boring==
- ==Visual learners (thanks to excellent multimedia content)==

[==Access it free at¬†oerproject.com==](http://oerproject.com/?utm_source=opened-daily.beehiiv.com&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=078-education-school)
